intro: Chlorophytum caulescens, commonly known as the spider plant, is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring long, arching leaves that are often striped with white. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are followed by bright orange berries. It is well-known for its ability to thrive in a variety of conditions, making it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor gardens. Its air-purifying qualities also make it a favored plant for improving indoor air quality.
